title: Distribution-free junta testing.
abstract: We study the problem of testing whether an unknown  n -variable Boolean function is a  k -junta in the distribution-free property testing model, where the distance between functions is measured with respect to an arbitrary and unknown probability distribution over {0,1}  n  . Our first main result is that distribution-free  k -junta testing can be performed, with one-sided error, by an adaptive algorithm that uses O( k  2 )/є queries (independent of  n ). Complementing this, our second main result is a lower bound showing that any non-adaptive distribution-free  k -junta testing algorithm must make Ω(2  k /3 ) queries even to test to accuracy є=1/3. These bounds establish that while the optimal query complexity of non-adaptive  k -junta testing is 2 Θ( k ) , for adaptive testing it is poly( k ), and thus show that adaptivity provides an exponential improvement in the distribution-free query complexity of testing juntas.
